tn.text: The word "hand" here represents God's actions or works. AT: "the power I show in my works" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob
tn.text: "I showed myself to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob"

tn.ref: I was not known to them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They did not know me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This means making sad sounds because of pain and suffering.
This is a command from Yahweh to Moses. AT: "Yahweh told Moses to say to the Israelites."

tn.ref: If the Israelites have not listened to me, why will Pharaoh listen to me, since I am not good at speaking?
tn.text: Moses asked this question hoping God would change His mind about using Moses. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "Since the Israelites did not listen to me, neither will Pharaoh, because I am not good at speaking!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: the heads of their fathers' houses
tn.text: Here "heads" refers to the original ancestors of the clan. AT: "the ancestors of the clans"
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: These were the heads of the fathers' houses
tn.text: The word "heads" here represents family leaders. AT: "These were the leaders of the families" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: by their groups of fighting men
tn.text: "one tribe at a time" or "one family group after another"

tn.ref: I am not good ... why will Pharaoh listen to me?
tn.text: Moses asks this question hoping to change God's mind. This rhetorical question can be translated as as statement. AT: "I am not good ... Pharaoh will certainly not listen to me!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
